info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 1:36PM CDT until June 13 at 12:10PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Salado Creek At at Loop 13 affecting Bexar County.
* WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Salado Creek at at Loop 13.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM CDT Thursday was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.0 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.0 feet on 05/06/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 745 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
